message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.MA. 

The paper deals with a problem of selecting exploration strategies for an agent in an unknown environment. This problem is closely related to reinforcement learning and decision-making, which are typically covered in the cs.AI and cs.LG sub-categories. The use of a simulated robotic arm suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the cs.RO sub-category. The method proposed in the paper involves treating the problem as a Multi-Armed Bandits problem, which falls under the cs.MA sub-category. Finally, the use of diversity as a reward signal suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the cs.SY sub-category, which deals with systems and control.
